meanings.definition: Capable of fading or losing color or brightness over time.
meanings.sent1: The old painting was fadable, with its colors slowly disappearing.
meanings.sent2: The fabric used for the curtains was fadable, so it needed to be replaced often.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her memory was as fadable as a cheap t-shirt.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant flowers in the garden had become fadable ghosts of their former selves.
meanings.sent5: The warning sign on the door was a reminder of the fadable nature of printed materials.

meanings.definition: Able to be easily forgotten or disregarded.
meanings.sent1: The unimportant details in the story were fadable, easily overlooked.
meanings.sent2: His name was fadable in her mind, as she struggled to recall it.
meanings.sent3: The trivial argument was so fadable that they both laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The promises made in haste were fadable whispers in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The temporary decorations were intentionally fadable, meant to be replaced frequently.
